item.title: Adding a System-Wide Git Logger on macOS
item.description: Git is both simple and, at times, complicated. While it’s initially encouraged to use the command line instead of apps like Tower or Fork, which offer a user-friendly interface, these apps can sometimes boost productivity. For instance, they provide a visual representation of branches and convenient ways to perform tasks like cloning, pulling, cherry-picking, and rebasing. However, not all of them offer a log or console to monitor the Git commands being executed behind the scenes.
